result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard Sveen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving Stolen Property >$5000 - $10,000 or Firearm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(bm).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Subject to work release and good time.

miscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/cost to be paid thru probation. Failure to pay will be a civil judgment.
$1000 restitution with 10% surcharge to the District Attorney office, to be paid thru probation.  Failure to pay is a civil judgment.  Joint/several with Joshua Vezina-2016CF88.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be paid thru probation.  Failure to pay will be a civil judgment.
May not possess or use firearms.

Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored, if considered a violent felony-no body armor, if not US citizen face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.

Must provide a DNA sample.
Must follow rules of supervision.

Defendant Richard  Sveen in court with attorney Mark Drew Biller.  Defendant Richard  Sveen in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  10:43 a.m. AO-Clerk.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Victims rights complied with. De waives PSI, ct accepts waiver.

Count 1 - AMENDED receiving stolen property 943.34(1)(bm).  De plea G. Ct accepts plea, adj. guilty.
Count 2 - DRI.
CT finds elig for CIP & SA pgm.
SENTENCE:  DNA sample, $250 surcharge.  $290.60-all payable thru probation. FTP-judgment. I&S 1 yr PCJ, subj to WR & GT.  Probation 2 yrs.  Must follow rules of supervision.  
Restitution $1000 with 10% surcharge, J/S with Josh Vezina 16CF88.
No firearms, cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored, if considered violent no body armor, if not US citizen face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.
180 days credit if revoked, 30 days to supplement the court.  PCR.  11:05 am adj.
